segment.source: How to Deploy a Workspace Image
segment.target: How to Deploy a Workspace Image

segment.source: When using a deployment package, a new image can be deployed onto client computers in one of the following ways:
segment.target: When using a deployment package, a new image can be deployed onto client computers in one of the following ways:

segment.source: Web download
segment.target: Web download

segment.source: Image pre-staging
segment.target: Image pre-staging

segment.source: Deploying the image inside the deployment package
segment.target: Deploying the image inside the deployment package

segment.source: How to Deploy a Workspace Image via the Web
segment.target: How to Deploy a Workspace Image via the Web

segment.source: To deploy a workspace image via the Web
segment.target: To deploy a workspace image via the Web

segment.source: Upload the MED-V image to the server.
segment.target: Upload the MED-V image to the server.

segment.source: For information on uploading the image, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.
segment.target: For information on uploading the image, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.

segment.source: Create a deployment package, and include the server path to the location of the image.
segment.target: Create a deployment package, and include the server path to the location of the image.

segment.source: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.
segment.target: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.

segment.source: Deploy the package to end users.
segment.target: Deploy the package to end users.

segment.source: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.
segment.target: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.

segment.source: MED-V client is installed and started for the first time.
segment.target: MED-V client is installed and started for the first time.

segment.source: On first-time startup, the client downloads the image from the server address specified in the client installation.
segment.target: On first-time startup, the client downloads the image from the server address specified in the client installation.

segment.source: How to Deploy a Workspace Image Using Image Pre-staging
segment.target: How to Deploy a Workspace Image Using Image Pre-staging

segment.source: To deploy a workspace image using image pre-staging
segment.target: To deploy a workspace image using image pre-staging

segment.source: Create an image pre-stage folder, and push the image to the folder.
segment.target: Create an image pre-stage folder, and push the image to the folder.

segment.source: For information on configuring image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.
segment.target: For information on configuring image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.

segment.source: Create a deployment package, and include the path to the image pre-stage folder.
segment.target: Create a deployment package, and include the path to the image pre-stage folder.

segment.source: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.
segment.target: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.

segment.source: Deploy the package to end users.
segment.target: Deploy the package to end users.

segment.source: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.
segment.target: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.

segment.source: MED-V client is installed and started for the first time.
segment.target: MED-V client is installed and started for the first time.

segment.source: On first-time startup, the client fetches the image from the pre-stage folder specified in the client installation.
segment.target: On first-time startup, the client fetches the image from the pre-stage folder specified in the client installation.

segment.source: How to Deploy a Workspace Image Using a Deployment Package
segment.target: How to Deploy a Workspace Image Using a Deployment Package

segment.source: To deploy a workspace image using a deployment package
segment.target: To deploy a workspace image using a deployment package

segment.source: Create a deployment package, and include the image in the package.
segment.target: Create a deployment package, and include the image in the package.

segment.source: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.
segment.target: For information on creating a deployment package, see How to Configure a Deployment Package.

segment.source: Deploy the package to end users.
segment.target: Deploy the package to end users.

segment.source: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.
segment.target: For information on deploying the package, see How to Install MED-V Client.

segment.source: The image is imported to the host as part of the package installation.
segment.target: The image is imported to the host as part of the package installation.
